title: Ru
summary: This article is a disambiguation page clarifying the various meanings of "Ru," "ru," or "RU" across different contexts. These include country codes for Russia, Chinese linguistic terms, numerous universities worldwide, scientific notations, transportation codes, and various other international references and uses.
text:
{{Wiktionary|ru|रु}}
'''Ru''', '''ru''', or '''RU''' may refer to:
{{TOC right}}

==Russia==
* [[Russia]] (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code)
* [[Russian language]] (ISO 639 alpha-2 code)
* [[.ru]], the Internet country code top-level domain for Russia

==China==
* Rù (入), the [[entering tone]] in Chinese language phonetics
* Rú (儒), a Chinese language term for [[Confucianism]]
* [[Ru (surname)]] (茹), a Chinese surname
* [[Ru River]] (汝), in Henan, China
* [[Ru ware]], a type of Chinese pottery

==Educational institutions==
*[[Rajasthan University]] in Rajasthan, India
* [[Radboud University Nijmegen]], in Nijmegen, Netherlands
* [[Radford University]], in Virginia, USA
* [[Rai University]] in Gujarat, India
* [[Rajshahi University]] in Bangladesh
* [[Rama University]] in India
* [[Ramkhamhaeng University]] in Thailand
* Rangoon University in Burma 
* [[Regis University]] in Colorado, USA
* [[Reykjavík University]] Iceland
* [[Rhodes University]] in Grahamstown, South Africa
* [[Rockefeller University]] in New York, USA 
* [[Rockhurst University]] in Missouri, USA
* [[Roosevelt University]] in Chicago, Illinois, USA
* [[Rowan University]] in New Jersey, USA
* [[Ruse University]] in Bulgaria
* [[Rutgers University]] in New Jersey, USA
* [[Ryerson University]], the former name of Toronto Metropolitan University in Ontario, Canada

==Science and technology==
* [[Resource Unit]], a unit used in 802.11 wireless
* [[Rack unit]], a measurement of the height of electronic equipment commonly installed in 19-inch racks
* [[Ruthenium]], symbol Ru, a chemical element
* The "backwards-R U" [[Recognized Component Mark]] of Underwriters Laboratories

==Transport==
* [[AirBridge Cargo]] (IATA airline code)
* [[Renigunta Junction railway station]] (Indian Railways station code)

==Other uses==
* ''[[Reino Unido]]'', the [[Spanish language|Spanish]] name of the United Kingdom
* ''[[Royaume-Uni]]'', the [[French language|French]] name of the United Kingdom
* ''[[Regno Unito]]'', the [[Italian language|Italian]] name of the United Kingdom
* [[Ru (kana)]], the romanisation of the Japanese kana る and ル
* [[Ru (cuneiform)]], a sign in cuneiform writing
* [[Ru (novel)|''Ru'' (novel)]], a novel by Canadian novelist Kim Thúy
*[[Ru (film)|''Ru ''(film)]], a film by Canadian director Charles-Olivier Michaud based on Kim Thúy's novel
* [[Ruanda-Urundi]], former German and Belgian colony (today Rwanda and Burundi)
*''[[Rückkehr unerwünscht]]'' "return unwanted", a Nazi designation for concentration camp prisoners who were forbidden to be released
* [[RuPaul]], an American drag queen, actor, and television personality 
* [[Rugby union]]

==See also==
*[[Rew (disambiguation)]]
*[[Rewe (disambiguation)]]
*[[Roo (disambiguation)]]
*[[Rou (disambiguation)]]
*[[Rue (disambiguation)]]
*[[Ruu]]

{{disambiguation}}

RuPaul's Drag Race Season 17 continues to generate buzz following recent controversy, while Russian (RU) military activities remain in focus with Putin's message to special forces. Additionally, telecommunications advancements featuring O-RU technology for 5G networks are making headlines in the tech industry with Metanoia's new power-efficient solution.

title: Maha_Shivaratri
summary: This article provides an overview of Maha Shivaratri, a significant Hindu festival dedicated to Lord Shiva, typically observed between February and March according to the Hindu calendar. The festival commemorates Shiva's wedding to Parvati and his Tandava dance, with devotees marking the occasion through fasting, prayer, meditation, and all-night vigils to symbolize overcoming darkness and ignorance.
extract: Maha Shivaratri is a Hindu festival celebrated annually in honour of the deity Shiva, between February and March. According to the Hindu calendar, the festival is observed on the fourteenth day of the first half of the lunar month of Phalguna. The festival commemorates the wedding of Shiva and Parvati, and the occasion that Shiva performs his divine dance, called the Tandava.
text:
{{Short description|Hindu festival dedicated to the god Shiva}} {{more citations needed|date=December 2023}} {{EngvarB|date=February 2025}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2025}} {{Infobox holiday | holiday_name = Maha Shivaratri | type = Hindu | image = 02 Mahashivratree festival.JPG | caption = Meditating Shiva statue on Maha-Shivaratri | observances = {{Bulleted_list|Fasting|Self-study|[[Jagran|Jagarana]]||[[Lingam]] [[Puja (Hinduism)|puja]]|[[Yoga]]{{cite book|first=J. Gordon|last=Melton|title=Religious Celebrations: An Encyclopedia of Holidays, Festivals, Solemn Observances, and Spiritual Commemorations|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=lD_2J7W_2hQC|year=2011|publisher=ABC-CLIO|isbn=978-1-59884-206-7|pages=541–542}}}} | observedby = [[Hindus]] | longtype = Religious | date = Phalguna Krishna Chaturdashi | significance = Commemoration of the wedding of Shiva and Parvati
Veneration of the Tandava dance of Shiva
Manifestation of the lingamStephen Knapp (2012), Hindu Gods & Goddesses, Jaico Publishing House, India, {{ISBN|9788184953664}}, page 110 | frequency = Annual | duration = 1 day | date2025 = 26 February }} {{Hindu festival date info}} {{Saivism}} '''Maha Shivaratri''' is a [[Hindu festival]] celebrated annually in honour of the deity [[Shiva]], between February and March.{{Cite book |last=Lochtefeld |first=James G. |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=GnmPzgEACAAJ |title=The Illustrated Encyclopedia of Hinduism: N-Z |date=2002 |publisher=Rosen |isbn=978-0-8239-3180-4 |pages=637 |language=en}} According to the [[Hindu calendar]], the festival is observed on the fourteenth day of the first half (night start with darkness - waning) of the [[lunar month]] of [[Phalguna]]. The festival commemorates the wedding of Shiva and [[Parvati]],{{Cite book |last1=Coulter |first1=Charles Russell |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=QEJUEAAAQBAJ&dq=shivaratri+wedding&pg=PA428 |title=Encyclopedia of Ancient Deities |last2=Turner |first2=Patricia |date=6 December 2021 |publisher=McFarland |isbn=978-0-7864-9179-7 |pages=428 |language=en}} and the occasion that Shiva performs his divine dance, called the [[Tandava]].{{cite book|author1=Om Prakash Juneja|author2=Chandra Mohan|title=Ambivalence: Studies in Canadian Literature |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=39FHAAAAYAAJ |year=1990|publisher=Allied|isbn=978-81-7023-109-7|pages=156–157}} It is a notable festival in [[Hinduism]], marking a remembrance of "overcoming darkness and ignorance" in life and the world. It is observed by remembering Shiva and chanting prayers, [[vrata|fasting]], and meditating on ethics and virtues such as honesty, non-injury to others, charity, forgiveness, and the discovery of Shiva. Ardent devotees stay awake throughout this night. Others visit one of the Shiva temples or go on a pilgrimage to the [[Jyotirlingam]]s. The festival is believed to have originated in 5th century BCE.{{cite book |last1=Jones |first1=Constance |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=OgMmceadQ3gC&pg=PA269 |title=Encyclopedia of Hinduism |last2=D. Ryan |first2=James |publisher=Infobase Publishing |year=2006 |isbn=978-0-8160-7564-5 |page=269}} In [[Kashmir Shaivism]], the festival is called Har-ratri or phonetically simpler Haerath or Herath by Shiva devotees of the Kashmir region.{{cite book|first=Stanley D. | last=Brunn|title=The Changing World Religion Map: Sacred Places, Identities, Practices and Politics|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=CGh-BgAAQBAJ&pg=PA403| year= 2015|publisher= Springer|isbn= 978-94-017-9376-6|pages= 402–403}}{{cite book|first=Asim | last=Maitra|title=Religious Life of the Brahman: A Case Study of Maithil Brahmans|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=f3LXAAAAMAAJ|year= 1986|publisher= Munshilal|isbn= 978-81-210-0171-7|page= 125}} ==Description== {{Quote box |quote = '''A festival of contemplation''' During the Vigil Night of Shiva, Mahashivaratri, we are brought to the moment of interval between destruction and regeneration; it symbolizes the night when we must contemplate on that which watches the growth out of the decay. During Mahashivaratri we have to be alone with our sword, the Shiva out of us. We have to look behind and before, to see what evil needs eradicating from our heart, what growth of virtue we need to encourage. Shiva is not only outside of us but within us. To unite ourselves with the One Self is to recognize the Shiva in us. |source = —''The Theosophical Movement, Volume 72''{{cite journal|title=Shiva|journal=The Theosophical Movement|volume=72|number=4|url=http://www.ultindia.org/tm_magazine/7204shiva
anthropic_trending_reason: Maha Shivaratri is trending because preparations are underway for the 2025 celebration scheduled for February 26, with devotees planning fasting, prayers, and special pujas to honor Lord Shiva. The Lingaraj Temple is specifically preparing for the Mahadipa ceremony, a significant ritual that forms part of the festival commemorating Shiva's marriage to Parvati and his cosmic dance.

Various news articles are highlighting the significance of the festival, including the anticipated Mahadipa ceremony at the Lingaraj Temple, and providing guidance on how to observe the festival through dos and don'ts.

title: Alabama_Barker
summary: The article provides an overview of Alabama Barker, an American media personality born in 2005 who is the daughter of Blink-182 drummer Travis Barker and actress Shanna Moakler. It details her family connections, including her stepmother Kourtney Kardashian, her early appearance on the TV show "Meet the Barkers," and her relationships with her siblings.
extract: Alabama Luella Barker is an American media personality. She is the daughter of Blink-182 drummer Travis Barker and his ex-wife, actress Shanna Moakler. In 2022, her father married Kourtney Kardashian, making Alabama her step-daughter.
anthropic_trending_reason: Alabama Barker is trending because of her ongoing public feud with rapper Bhad Bhabie, which has escalated with both releasing diss tracks against each other. Bhad Bhabie recently released a song called "Ms. Whitman" aimed at Alabama, which controversially featured a Travis Barker lookalike in the music video. The situation has gained additional attention after Kanye West publicly called out Bhad Bhabie in support of Travis Barker and his daughter.
openai_trending_reason: Alabama Barker is trending because of her ongoing public feud with Bhad Bhabie, which has escalated with the release of diss tracks targeting each other. Bhad Bhabie's recent track "Ms. Whitman" specifically mentions Alabama and features a lookalike of her father, Travis Barker, further fueling the drama and capturing public attention.

title: Costco
summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of Costco Wholesale Corporation, describing it as an American multinational corporation that operates membership-only big-box warehouse club retail stores. The extract highlights Costco's significant market position as the third-largest retailer globally, the world's largest retailer of several food categories including beef and wine, and its ranking as #11 on the Fortune 500 list of largest U.S. corporations by revenue.
extract: Costco Wholesale Corporation is an American multinational corporation which operates a chain of membership-only big-box warehouse club retail stores. As of 2021, Costco is the third-largest retailer in the world. As of August 2024, Costco is the world's largest retailer of beef, poultry, organic produce, and wine, and just under one-third of American consumers regularly shop at Costco warehouses. Costco is ranked #11 on the Fortune 500 rankings of the largest United States corporations by total revenue. Costco originally began with a wholesale business model aimed at enrolling businesses as members, then also began to enroll individual consumers and sell products intended for them, including its own private label brand.

|title=How Costco Hacked the American Shopping Psyche |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2024/08/20/dining/costco.html |work=The New York Times |date=August 20, 2024 |url-access=subscription}} This article states that [[FedMart]] "became" Costco, which is incorrect. Sol Price founded [[Price Club]] after leaving FedMart. title: Monolith_Productions
summary: This article is about Monolith Productions, an American video game developer based in Kirkland, Washington, which operated from 1994 until its closure in February 2025. The article details the company's history, including its founding, acquisition by Warner Bros. Games in 2004, and ultimate dissolution after Warner Bros. decided to shut down the studio.
extract: Monolith Productions, Inc. was an American video game developer based in Kirkland, Washington. The company has been a subsidiary of Warner Bros. Games since August 2004. It formerly published third-party games in the 1990s. In February 2025 it was reported that Warner Bros. Games had decided to close the studio.
anthropic_trending_reason: Monolith Productions is trending because Warner Bros. Games has announced it's shutting down the studio along with two other game development studios. The closure results in the cancellation of the anticipated Wonder Woman game that was in development, ending the legacy of the studio known for titles like Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor.
openai_trending_reason: Monolith Productions is trending because Warner Bros. Discovery has announced the closure of the studio and the cancellation of its highly anticipated Wonder Woman game as part of a corporate restructuring. This decision marks a significant shift in the gaming landscape, highlighting the evolving priorities within Warner Bros. Games.
